extracted.value: Granted motion to stay case management deadlines pending resolution of consent decree motion (Doc. 10, 12/20/2024)

evidence.text: ORDER granting 10 Motion to Stay is GRANTED and that all case management deadlines, including the United States' deadline to serve the Summons and Complaint on the City of Durham, are stayed pending the courts resolution of the Parties' Joint Motion for Provisional Approval and Entry of Consent Decree. Signed by JUDGE THOMAS D. SCHROEDER on 12/20/2024.

patch.value: Granted motion to exceed word limit for briefing on Ricci v. Destefano applicability (Doc. 13, 01/15/2025)

evidence.text: ORDER signed by JUDGE THOMAS D. SCHROEDER on 01/15/2025, that the motion (Doc. 13 ) is GRANTED. The word limit for the briefing the court requested regarding the applicability of Ricci v. Destefano, 557 U.S. 557 (2009), (Minute Entry Dec. 16, 2014), is increased to 9,000 words.

patch.value: Granted motion for leave to file amicus brief and appear at argument (Doc. 14, 01/15/2025)

evidence.text: ORDER that the motion 14 is GRANTED in that American Alliance for Equal Rights is granted leave to file its brief as amicus curiae as a separate document forthwith. The court reserves decision on whether the Alliance shall be granted leave to present argument at any future hearing. See L.R. 7.5(f). Signed by JUDGE THOMAS D. SCHROEDER on 01/15/2025.

patch.value: Granted motion for L.R. 5.5 Report on sealed documents (Doc. 26, 01/30/2025)

evidence.text: ORDER signed by MAG/JUDGE JOI ELIZABETH PEAKE on 01/30/2025, granting 26 Motion for L.R. 5.5 Report-Joint as approved as submitted.

patch.value: Granted joint motion for provisional approval and entry of consent decree, provisionally entering decree and scheduling fairness hearing (Doc. 2, 10/07/2024)

evidence.text: Upon consideration of the Joint Motion for Provisional Approval and Entry of Consent Decree filed by Plaintiff United States of America and Defendant City of Durham, North Carolina, and subject to final decision based on any objections, the Court finds that the terms of the proposed Consent Decree are fair, adequate, reasonable, and are not illegal, a product of collusion, or against the public interest. Therefore, it is hereby: ORDERED that the Motion is GRANTED, and the Consent Decree is PROVISIONALLY ENTERED; and it is further ORDERED that the Fairness Hearing on the Terms of the Consent Decree is scheduled to be held on ________________, 2025 at __________________; and it is further ORDERED that all case management deadlines are stayed pending the Court’s determination, at or after the Fairness Hearing on the Terms of the Consent Decree, whether to enter the Consent Decree as a Final Order.

the Motion is GRANTED, and the Consent Decree is PROVISIONALLY ENTERED; and it is further ORDERED that the Fairness Hearing on the Terms of the Consent Decree is scheduled to be held on ________________, 2025 at __________________; and it is further ORDERED that all case management deadlines are stayed pending the Court’s determination, at or after the Fairness Hearing on the Terms of the Consent Decree, whether to enter the Consent Decree as a Final Order.

add_extracted.value: The court granted the Joint Motion for Provisional Approval and Entry of Consent Decree, provisionally entering the Consent Decree and scheduling a Fairness Hearing, with case management deadlines stayed pending final determination.

evidence.text: ORDER granting 10 Motion to Stay is GRANTED and that all case management deadlines, including the United States' deadline to serve the Summons and Complaint on the City of Durham, are stayed pending the courts resolution of the Parties' Joint Motion for Provisional Approval and Entry of Consent Decree.

add_extracted.value: The court granted the Motion to Stay Case Management Deadlines, staying all deadlines including service of Summons and Complaint pending resolution of the Consent Decree motion.

evidence.text: ORDER signed by JUDGE THOMAS D. SCHROEDER on 01/15/2025, that the motion (Doc. 13 ) is GRANTED. The word limit for the briefing the court requested regarding the applicability of Ricci v. DeStefano, 557 U.S. 557 (2009), (Minute Entry Dec. 16, 2014), is increased to 9,000 words.

add_extracted.value: The court granted the Motion to Exceed Word Limit, increasing the word limit for briefing on the applicability of Ricci v. Destefano to 9,000 words.

evidence.text: ORDER that the motion 14 is GRANTED in that American Alliance for Equal Rights is granted leave to file its brief as amicus curiae as a separate document forthwith. The court reserves decision on whether the Alliance shall be granted leave to present argument at any future hearing. See L.R. 7.5(f).

add_extracted.value: The court granted the Motion for Leave to File Amicus Brief, allowing the American Alliance for Equal Rights to file its brief as amicus curiae as a separate document, with reservation on argument at future hearing.

evidence.text: Plaintiff United States of America hereby dismisses the above-captioned case pursuant to Federal Rule of Civil Procedure 41(a)(1).

add_extracted.value: The court dismissed the case pursuant to Federal Rule of Civil Procedure 41(a)(1), as the plaintiff voluntarily dismissed the action without the defendant having filed an answer or motion for summary judgment, making the dismissal self-executing and effective upon filing.

args.reason: All checklist items (Court_Rulings) are fully extracted with 5 distinct values, each with supporting evidence from visited documents (Order, Docket, Notice of Voluntary Dismissal). Unvisited documents (Complaint, Consent Decree, Joint Motion) are unlikely to contain additional court rulings as they are non-order documents. Checklist status shows 1/1 filled with no empty keys.
